definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: Save me form the dying embers hidden under ashes.
sentences.chinese: 拯救我于飞灰底下隐藏的将灭的馀烬。

sentences.english: The secret of success is constancy of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 烬成功的秘诀在于持之于恒。

sentences.english: These festivals will gradually rekindle the dying spark of spiritual taste.
sentences.chinese: 这些节日将逐渐地重燃这将烬的灵性品味火花。

definition: (literary) beauty (usually of a maid or concubine)
Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
